description:
PVD (Plasma Vapour Deposition) magnetron is a device that essentially smashes heavy gas particles on a target
        material and causes it to spray off and adhere to a nearby surface. This process can easily cover almost
        anything in thin metal layers! This might come in handy when imaging with my planned-to-do electron microscope
        (it requires a conducive surface for the electrons to bounce off) and to create semi-transparent mirrors (maybe
        even, in the future, a thin layer filters).
